1.verse: ALEPH. Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the LORD.

2.verse: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.

3.verse: They also do no iniquity: they walk in his ways.

4.verse: Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.

5.verse: O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!

6.verse: Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.

7.verse: I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.

8.verse: I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.

9.verse: BETH. Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed thereto according to thy word.

10.verse: With my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander from thy commandments.

11.verse: Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.

12.verse: Blessed art thou, O LORD: teach me thy statutes.

13.verse: With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.

14.verse: I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies, as much as in all riches.

15.verse: I will meditate in thy precepts, and have respect unto thy ways.

16.verse: I will delight myself in thy statutes: I will not forget thy word.

17.verse: GIMEL. Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.

18.verse: Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.

19.verse: I am a stranger in the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.

20.verse: My soul breaketh for the longing that it hath unto thy judgments at all times.

21.verse: Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed, which do err from thy commandments.

22.verse: Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.

23.verse: Princes also did sit and speak against me: but thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.

24.verse: Thy testimonies also are my delight and my counsellors.

25.verse: DALETH. My soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me according to thy word.

26.verse: I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.

27.verse: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

28.verse: My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according unto thy word.

29.verse: Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.

30.verse: I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid before me.

31.verse: I have stuck unto thy testimonies: O LORD, put me not to shame.

32.verse: I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.

33.verse: HE. Teach me, O LORD, the way of thy statutes; and I shall keep it unto the end.

34.verse: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.

35.verse: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.

36.verse: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.

37.verse: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity; and quicken thou me in thy way.

38.verse: Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.

39.verse: Turn away my reproach which I fear: for thy judgments are good.

40.verse: Behold, I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy righteousness.

41.verse: VAU. Let thy mercies come also unto me, O LORD, even thy salvation, according to thy word.

42.verse: So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.

43.verse: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.

44.verse: So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.

45.verse: And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.

46.verse: I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings, and will not be ashamed.

47.verse: And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.

48.verse: My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.

49.verse: ZAIN. Remember the word unto thy servant, upon which thou hast caused me to hope.

50.verse: This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.

51.verse: The proud have had me greatly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy law.

52.verse: I remembered thy judgments of old, O LORD; and have comforted myself.

53.verse: Horror hath taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.

54.verse: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.

55.verse: I have remembered thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have kept thy law.

56.verse: This I had, because I kept thy precepts.

57.verse: CHETH. Thou art my portion, O LORD: I have said that I would keep thy words.

58.verse: I intreated thy favour with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.

59.verse: I thought on my ways, and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

60.verse: I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.

61.verse: The bands of the wicked have robbed me: but I have not forgotten thy law.

62.verse: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of thy righteous judgments.

63.verse: I am a companion of all them that fear thee, and of them that keep thy precepts.

64.verse: The earth, O LORD, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.

65.verse: TETH. Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O LORD, according unto thy word.

66.verse: Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.

67.verse: Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept thy word.

68.verse: Thou art good, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.

69.verse: The proud have forged a lie against me: but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.

70.verse: Their heart is as fat as grease; but I delight in thy law.

71.verse: It is good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.

72.verse: The law of thy mouth is better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.

73.verse: JOD. Thy hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.

74.verse: They that fear thee will be glad when they see me; because I have hoped in thy word.

75.verse: I know, O LORD, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.

76.verse: Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.

77.verse: Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy law is my delight.

78.verse: Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: but I will meditate in thy precepts.

79.verse: Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that have known thy testimonies.

80.verse: Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.

81.verse: CAPH. My soul fainteth for thy salvation: but I hope in thy word.

82.verse: Mine eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?

83.verse: For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; yet do I not forget thy statutes.

84.verse: How many are the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

85.verse: The proud have digged pits for me, which are not after thy law.

86.verse: All thy commandments are faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.

87.verse: They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.

88.verse: Quicken me after thy lovingkindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.

89.verse: LAMED. For ever, O LORD, thy word is settled in heaven.

90.verse: Thy faithfulness is unto all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.

91.verse: They continue this day according to thine ordinances: for all are thy servants.

92.verse: Unless thy law had been my delights, I should then have perished in mine affliction.

93.verse: I will never forget thy precepts: for with them thou hast quickened me.

94.verse: I am thine, save me; for I have sought thy precepts.

95.verse: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.

96.verse: I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.

97.verse: MEM. O how love I thy law! it is my meditation all the day.

98.verse: Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.

99.verse: I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.

100.verse: I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.

101.verse: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.

102.verse: I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.

103.verse: How sweet are thy words unto my taste! yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

104.verse: Through thy precepts I get understanding: therefore I hate every false way.

105.verse: NUN. Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

106.verse: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.

107.verse: I am afflicted very much: quicken me, O LORD, according unto thy word.

108.verse: Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O LORD, and teach me thy judgments.

109.verse: My soul is continually in my hand: yet do I not forget thy law.

110.verse: The wicked have laid a snare for me: yet I erred not from thy precepts.

111.verse: Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they are the rejoicing of my heart.

112.verse: I have inclined mine heart to perform thy statutes alway, even unto the end.

113.verse: SAMECH. I hate vain thoughts: but thy law do I love.

114.verse: Thou art my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.

115.verse: Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments of my God.

116.verse: Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.

117.verse: Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.

118.verse: Thou hast trodden down all them that err from thy statutes: for their deceit is falsehood.

119.verse: Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.

120.verse: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.

121.verse: AIN. I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.

122.verse: Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.

123.verse: Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.

124.verse: Deal with thy servant according unto thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.

125.verse: I am thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.

126.verse: It is time for thee, LORD, to work: for they have made void thy law.

127.verse: Therefore I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold.

128.verse: Therefore I esteem all thy precepts concerning all things to be right; and I hate every false way.

129.verse: PE. Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.

130.verse: The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.

131.verse: I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.

132.verse: Look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy name.

133.verse: Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

134.verse: Deliver me from the oppression of man: so will I keep thy precepts.

135.verse: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; and teach me thy statutes.

136.verse: Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.

137.verse: TZADDI. Righteous art thou, O LORD, and upright are thy judgments.

138.verse: Thy testimonies that thou hast commanded are righteous and very faithful.

139.verse: My zeal hath consumed me, because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.

140.verse: Thy word is very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.

141.verse: I am small and despised: yet do not I forget thy precepts.

142.verse: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy law is the truth.

143.verse: Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me: yet thy commandments are my delights.

144.verse: The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting: give me understanding, and I shall live.

145.verse: KOPH. I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O LORD: I will keep thy statutes.

146.verse: I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.

147.verse: I prevented the dawning of the morning, and cried: I hoped in thy word.

148.verse: Mine eyes prevent the night watches, that I might meditate in thy word.

149.verse: Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness: O LORD, quicken me according to thy judgment.

150.verse: They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.

151.verse: Thou art near, O LORD; and all thy commandments are truth.

152.verse: Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.

153.verse: RESH. Consider mine affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.

154.verse: Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.

155.verse: Salvation is far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.

156.verse: Great are thy tender mercies, O LORD: quicken me according to thy judgments.

157.verse: Many are my persecutors and mine enemies; yet do I not decline from thy testimonies.

158.verse: I beheld the transgressors, and was grieved; because they kept not thy word.

159.verse: Consider how I love thy precepts: quicken me, O LORD, according to thy lovingkindness.

160.verse: Thy word is true from the beginning: and every one of thy righteous judgments endureth for ever.

161.verse: SCHIN. Princes have persecuted me without a cause: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

162.verse: I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.

163.verse: I hate and abhor lying: but thy law do I love.

164.verse: Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.

165.verse: Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.

166.verse: LORD, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.

167.verse: My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.

168.verse: I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways are before thee.

169.verse: TAU. Let my cry come near before thee, O LORD: give me understanding according to thy word.

170.verse: Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.

171.verse: My lips shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

172.verse: My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteousness.

173.verse: Let thine hand help me; for I have chosen thy precepts.

174.verse: I have longed for thy salvation, O LORD; and thy law is my delight.

175.verse: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.

176.verse: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant; for I do not forget thy commandments.
